info.description:
Welcome to the Hudu REST API documentation. The Hudu REST API enables seamless automation of your IT documentation. The API is organized into various resources, each with its own specific endpoint.

All API requests require authentication using an API key. To obtain an API key, navigate to Hudu Admin Basic Information API Keys. Include the API key in your request headers as shown below:

curl https://[YOUR_DOMAIN]/api/v1/companies?page=1 -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY_HERE"

You can create and delete API keys at any time.

Scoping API Keys

API keys can be configured with the following options:

1. Access to passwords (all REST actions)
2. Ability to perform destructive actions (DELETE actions)
3. Ability to perform exports
4. Specify whitelisted IPs
5. Specify company scopes

These options can only be configured during the creation of the key.

We recommend limiting access and providing only the required permissions for each application.

Format

All API requests must use JSON format, unless otherwise specified.

Names in the API

Note that some names in the API may differ from those in your Hudu application:

Name in Hudu Name in API
Company (customizable) Company
Password AssetPassword
Knowledge Base Article Article
Process Procedure

Pagination

API requests are paginated by default. To navigate between pages, simply add ?page=X to your request. Pagination is in sets of 25 results.

Rate Limiting

The rate limit is set at 300 requests per minute.

© 2023 Hudu Technologies, Inc. All rights reserved.

delete.description: This endpoint allows you to delete activity logs from a specific datetime. If the 'delete_unassigned_logs' parameter is set to true, only logs where user_id is nil will be deleted.

parameters.description: Specify the starting datetime from which logs will be deleted; must be in ISO 8601 format
parameters.name: datetime

parameters.description: If true, only deletes logs where user_id is nil
parameters.name: delete_unassigned_logs

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid datetime format or missing datetime parameter

parameters.description: Specify the current page of results to retrieve
parameters.name: page

parameters.name: user_id

parameters.name: user_email

parameters.description: Filter logs by resource ID; must be used in conjunction with resource_type
parameters.name: resource_id

parameters.name: resource_type

parameters.description: Filter logs by the action performed
parameters.name: action_message

parameters.description: Filter logs starting from a specific date; must be in ISO 8601 format
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.name: page_size

parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Filter articles updated within a range or at an exact time. Format: 'start_datetime,end_datetime' for range, 'exact_datetime' for exact match. Both 'start_datetime' and 'end_datetime' should be in ISO 8601 format. If 'start_datetime' is provided and 'end_datetime' is blank, it filters articles updated from 'start_datetime' until now. Example: '2023-06-07T12:34:56Z,' If 'end_datetime' is provided and 'start_datetime' is blank, it filters articles updated from the past until 'end_datetime'. Example: ',2023-06-07T12:34:56Z' If both 'start_datetime' and 'end_datetime' are provided, it filters articles updated within that range. Example: '2023-06-01T12:34:56Z,2023-06-07T12:34:56Z'
parameters.name: updated_at

get.description:
The `/cards/jump` endpoint provides an easy way to create links from external integrations to Hudu. Below are examples of how to jump from a Syncro contact and a Watchman Monitoring computer to the corresponding asset in Hudu:
- Syncro example:
  ```
  https://[MY_URL_HERE]/api/v1/cards/jump?integration_id=XXXX&integration_slug=syncro&integration_type=contact
  ```

- Watchman Monitoring example (using identifier instead of ID):
  ```
  https://[MY_URL_HERE]/api/v1/cards/jump?integration_identifier=XXXX&integration_slug=watchman&integration_type=computer
  ```

parameters.description: Type of card. Contact support@usehudu.com for a list of types for specific integrations.
parameters.name: integration_type

parameters.description: Identifier of the external integration.
parameters.name: integration_slug

parameters.description: ID of the entity in the external integration.
parameters.name: integration_id

parameters.description: Identifier of the entity in the external integration (if integration_id is not set).
parameters.name: integration_identifier

get.summary: Jump to an asset with integration details without API key authentication, only requiring authentication at the time of jump.

parameters.description: Filter companies updated within a range or at an exact time. Format: 'start_datetime,end_datetime' for range, 'exact_datetime' for exact match. Both 'start_datetime' and 'end_datetime' should be in ISO 8601 format. If 'start_datetime' is provided and 'end_datetime' is blank, it filters companies updated from 'start_datetime' until now. Example: '2023-06-07T12:34:56Z,' If 'end_datetime' is provided and 'start_datetime' is blank, it filters companies updated from the past until 'end_datetime'. Example: ',2023-06-07T12:34:56Z' If both 'start_datetime' and 'end_datetime' are provided, it filters companies updated within that range. Example: '2023-06-01T12:34:56Z,2023-06-07T12:34:56Z'
parameters.name: updated_at

put.description:
Update the specified asset with new information. Asset data should be sent in the body of the request in JSON format. NOTE: to update fields you must use the 'custom_fields' key. Then specify the label and value as a key pair. The label must in snake case (lowercase with underscores instead of spaces) For example: 
{"asset":{"name": "new name", "asset_layout_id": 3, "primary_serial": "new serial", "custom_fields": [{"brand": "Apple", "model": "MacBook Pro"}]}}

parameters.description: The updated asset data in JSON format
parameters.name: asset

parameters.description: The identifier of the requested Asset
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The identifier of the requested parent Company
parameters.name: company_id

put.description: Archives the specified Asset. Returns a 200 status code if successful.

parameters.description: The identifier of the requested Asset
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The identifier of the requested parent Company
parameters.name: company_id

put.description:
Moves an Asset to a new Layout while preserving field values. The system will:

1. Match existing fields between layouts by exact label and type (case-sensitive, spaces matter)
2. Create new fields in the target layout if they don't exist
3. Transfer all field values to their corresponding fields in the new layout
4. Validate that any required fields in the new layout exist in the current layout

Note: Fields are matched by their label and type. If a field with the same label (case-sensitive, spaces matter) and type exists in the target layout, the asset's field value will be mapped to that existing field. If no matching field exists, a new one will be created with the same properties as the source field.

parameters.description: ID of the parent company
parameters.name: company_id

parameters.description: ID of the asset to move
parameters.name: id

asset_layout_id.description: ID of the new asset layout

200.description: Asset successfully moved to new layout

put.summary: Move asset to a different layout

put.description: Unarchives the specified Asset. Returns a 200 status code if successful.

is_inverse.description: When a relation is created, it will also create another relation that is the inverse. When this is true, this relation is the inverse.

toable_id.description: The ID of the destination entity in the relation

toable_type.description: The type of the destination entity in the relation (Asset, Website, Procedure, AssetPassword, Company, Article)

delete.description: Remove a relation between two entities by its ID.

parameters.description: ID of the Relation to be deleted
parameters.name: id

post.description: Initiate a s3 export. You must configure your S3-compatible credentials in the account settings page before using this endpoint.

parameters.description: Filter by search query
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Filter websites updated within a range or at an exact time. Format: 'start_datetime,end_datetime' for range, 'exact_datetime' for exact match. Both 'start_datetime' and 'end_datetime' should be in ISO 8601 format. If 'start_datetime' is provided and 'end_datetime' is blank, it filters websites updated from 'start_datetime' until now. Example: '2023-06-07T12:34:56Z,' If 'end_datetime' is provided and 'start_datetime' is blank, it filters websites updated from the past until 'end_datetime'. Example: ',2023-06-07T12:34:56Z' If both 'start_datetime' and 'end_datetime' are provided, it filters websites updated within that range. Example: '2023-06-01T12:34:56Z,2023-06-07T12:34:56Z'
parameters.name: updated_at

get.summary: Get a list of all websites

company_id.description: Used to associate website with company

disable_dns.description: When true, DNS monitoring is paused

disable_ssl.description: When true, SSL certificate monitoring is paused

disable_whois.description: When true, WHOIS monitoring is paused

name.description: The name or URL of the website

notes.description: Add additional notes to a website

paused.description: When true, website monitoring is paused
